author: Special Correspondent
text:
The first phase of the week-long oral polio vaccine immunisation programme will be held from January 17, targeting 71.5 lakh children below the age of five in the State.

In an effort to achieve ‘zero drop out’ the government will set up polio vaccine booths in beaches and zoos too this year. This is in addition to public places such as bus stands, toll plazas and railway stations.

On Sunday, the vaccine will be administered from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. to all children, including newborns, in anganwadis, noon meal centres and schools. In all government health centres, including primary and tertiary care hospitals, vaccine would be made available round-the-clock, said Health Minister C. Vijaya Baskar.

In the first phase of the immunisation drive this year, a total of 43,051 booths will be set up besides 1,652 transit booths and 1,000 mobile teams. The transit booths will function from public places, including places where large groups of people congregate, according to Health Secretary J. Radhakrishnan. Mobile teams will reach out to children in remote and inaccessible areas. Over two lakh health workers, anganwadi employees, teachers and volunteers are involved.

Director of Public Health K. Kolandaisamy said areas that had been inundated during the December flood had been identified as high-risk. All children who had been immunised under to the national immunisation programme just a few days ahead of Sunday would also be administered the vaccine.
title: Polio vaccine drive today
